title: Colorful Sweet Potato and Zucchini Hash
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced into 1/2-inch cubes
4 green onions, thinly sliced (white and green parts separated)
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. 2. Toss diced sweet potatoes with 2 tablespoons olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread in a single layer on the baking sheet. 3. Roast sweet potatoes for 15 minutes, stirring once halfway through. 4. While sweet potatoes roast, heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 5. Add white parts of green onions and garlic to the skillet. Sauté for 1 minute until fragrant. 6. Add diced zucchini, smoked paprika, cumin, and red pepper flakes. Season with salt and pepper. 7. Cook zucchini for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender but still slightly crisp. 8. Add roasted sweet potatoes to the skillet with zucchini. Toss everything together and cook for 2-3 minutes to combine flavors. 9. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice and green parts of green onions. 10. Taste and adjust seasoning. Garnish with fresh parsley if desired and serve immediately.
description: A vibrant, nutrient-packed vegetable hash featuring roasted sweet potatoes and sautéed zucchini, topped with fresh green onions. This versatile dish works as a healthy dinner side or can be topped with eggs for a complete meal.
